page.title: 12Highbrook - Centenary
page.content: The main celebrations of the centenary year will take place at the Patronal Festival when the bishop of Horsham will attend the service and preach. However, a full programme of events has taken place throughout the year starting with a parish party in January, a barn dance in February, and olympic style sports event when all the different sports were played and an unusual ball throwing competition was organised in the village lane. In July a flower festival was held in the church and the kneelers were recovered in tapestry depicting scenes of the countryside. Other events included a harvest supper a bonfire night and a pantomime. A commemorative mug was produced. As a lasting reminder a Cedar tree will be planted in the churchyard during the Patronal Festival.
